intro: Glosocomia tenera, commonly known as the slender glossothrix, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it requires careful handling due to its toxic properties.
